general.headline: Head of HR at Aggreko Australia-Pacific
general.description:
I guess we all know that human resource management is essentially a collection of functions that assist an organisation deliver value through it's people. I believe we do this by balancing three main areas.

1. Protecting the organisation and it's people (ensuring we comply with all relevant legislation and safety requirements)
2. Being the voice for the people in the organisation (treat people fairly and have fun along the way!)
3. Driving behaviour and activity towards the organisations vision (to help the organisation achieve its goals)

I am a Human Resource Management enthusiast that has successfully worked across the whole employee lifecycle (including safety). My passion is to bring out the best in others to increase their effectiveness and improve results.

Driven by honest values, an amazing culture, and consistent revenue growth, my goal is to unleash the potential in every team and become a trusted partner with my stakeholders and candidates. I am a Technical  Recruiter with extensive experience in Sydney market. My reputation in the market is based on a high level of professionalism and ethics and a consultative approach, providing strong market and domain knowledge and an exceptional level of service.

•	Talent Pooling
•	Business Development

Recruitment
Talent Acquisition

Career Highlights
• Recognised as being amongst the Top Billers at Hudson  
• Increased customer satisfaction and contributed to Net promoter score across Yellow Pages and White Pages as a key project lead.
• In 2009 delivered 500K in cost-savings to the business through customer retention strategy.
• Created training materials, call assessment criteria and manuals to implement call quality across Sales, Care & Claims.

jobs.description:
Macquarie Group is a global provider of banking, financial, advisory, investment and funds management services. Macquarie's main business focus is making returns by providing a diversified range of services to clients. Macquarie acts on behalf of institutional, corporate and retail clients and counterparties around the world. They have expertise in specific industries, including resources and commodities, energy, financial institutions, infrastructure and real estate. For more information on Macquarie, visit www.macquarie.com

Macquarie Group partners with Hudson RPO globally to attract and hire the best talent in the market. Our team is embedded within Macquarie’s business and we connect directly with talent through established and emerging social mediums and nurture ongoing relationships. As talent advisers we add value to our stakeholders through the provision of meaningful market and recruitment data to help them make better hiring decisions. The team’s commitment to operational excellence and delivering exceptional outcomes for our stakeholders has recently been formally recognised through an Award by our RPO peers across Asia Pacific.

Key responsibilities include executing recruitment strategies, full cycle recruitment, market mapping, candidate and client management, diversity sourcing, targeted sourcing strategies (using LinkedIn Recruiter, Seek talent database, search engines, headhunting, job boards, attending networking events,  Meetups etc.),  creating talent pool, interview process management, writing job ads, candidate interviews, screening, and offer management.  Recruiting passive candidates with the mentality to profile people for fit and understand their motivation rather than just sell a role. Build and maintain network of potential candidates through pro-active market research and on-going relationship management; conducts in-depth interviews of potential candidates, demonstrating ability to anticipate hiring manager preferences through high offer-to-interview ratios. Recommend ideas and strategies related to recruitment that will contribute to the long-range growth of the company. Provide effective coaching strategies for interview preparation as part of candidate management. Deliver projects/recruiting initiatives, including assessment of best practices in interviewing techniques. 
Key Achievements:
•	Consulting with Businesses for identifying current and future hiring needs – Particularly building a cold desk and working with Top Tier Professional Services firms
•	Recognized as being amongst the top Billers in Sydney and Australia 
•	Effectively managed end to end recruitment process including sourcing, screening candidates, interviewing, representing candidates, and managing the offer, negotiation and acceptance
•	Build and manage a pipeline of clients and candidates delivering over $100K in Quarter 2 in revenue
Awards:
•	Nominated for Asia-Pac Rising Star award based on revenue generated and customer satisfaction results. 
•	Having an extensive talent pool of candidates through LinkedIn Recruiter, in-house database and other job boards making sourcing quick and efficient

general.headline: Talent Acquisition Specialist by trade, people person by nature.
general.description:
A career history in finding the right people for the right jobs, but a passion for developing people and their potential. I'm a true believer that foundations for success don't begin with a business, its services or its infrastructure, but with the community working within it and the support they're given to thrive. Plenty of buzzwords could describe for you how important that is to me, but instead, let me tell you a couple of things that really excite me about this people passion of mine. I come to work every day with the opportunity to work with and develop relationships at every level of the business, I'm exposed to the incredible diversity of thought and skill that a large company like Urban Utilities has to offer, and I get to embrace some seriously cool tech that makes my role less 'admin' and more 'people'. 

My career means I get to spend every day influencing leaders, showing people how to best align their values and skills, and placing them in positions they enjoy getting up and coming to work for. 

I've got a not-so-hidden 'talent' for making people feel comfortable and welcomed, and I'm committed to carrying that with me where ever I go. I get so much fulfilment out of seeing people do their best. So here's to people power!

This was a fast-paced role in a constantly changing and exciting environment. Since then, I went on to work with catering, safety, finance, eCommerce, and sales and marketing departments, demonstrating my ability to nimbly adapt to changing business requirements and quickly pick up new portfolios.

jobs.jobTitle: Acting Local Area Co Coordinator for Barron River & Mossman Area
jobs.description:
Local area coordination , local knowledge and local support for people with a disability. 
If you are a person with a disability, building or strengthening your support and friendship networks can help you get the most out of life. Disability Services Local area Coordinators can help you achieve this by linking people with a disability to a range of different support networks and services, depending on individual needs and interests. We will work with you and your family, friends and local community to 
. get to know and understand you and your family 
. assist you to set goals and plan for the future
. build and strengthen your support networks and friendships
. connect you to other families to share ideas and experiences
. look at ways for you to maintain or gain more independence in your daily life
. identify how you can participate in social, recreational or other interests and be part of community life
. link you to practical assistance
We offer support to families and carers to assist them in the important role they play in the lives of people with a disability

general.headline: Support Analyst at Department of Communities, Child Safety and Disability Services (Qld)
general.company: Department of Communities, Child Safety and Disability Services

jobs.companyName: Department of Communities, Child Safety and Disability Services
jobs.description:
In my current role as a Senior Business Engagement officer I manage 5 portfolios across the Department of Communities, Child Safety and Disabilities Services (DCCSDS). I provide ICT Business engagement across all levels of clients including Executive Directors.

I collaborated with key stake holders of the business, Information Security, Assistant Regional Director and Director of Engagement & Reform to elicit the information. 

I have coordinated, monitored and supported the small to midsized operational project to coordinate the upgrade of one of my client portfolio's.

My is to draw the business requirements from the clients, while capturing and disseminating technical and business information I facilitated the planning and implementation changes. 

While capturing this data I identify a key business program which the business unit uses, which required a separate operation system to run. I consulted with tier 3 technical management to create a separate process in which they are able to continue with this key business program while continuing with the upgrade of their operating system. 

I demonstrate strategic leadership by identifying business improvement by further enhancing changes to the system to ensure that Information Services is moving forward with initiative ideas.

I facilitate discussion's with Technical teams to develop documents for gap analysis and traceability, these documents included, Business Requirements Specification, and Business Process (current and future) using BPMN. With this I was able identify the key business area in which I was required to Collaborate with to create the business process for the new solution.

jobs.companyName: Department of Communities, Child Safety and Disability Services (Qld)
jobs.description:
During my 8+ years providing ICT support within Queensland Government, I have gained extensive experience in providing client and technology management, including investigation of solutions for complex ICT issues and requirements.
In my current role as Support Analyst in the Brisbane South West region, I provide dedicated end user support and advice to clients both onsite and remotely. This involves support for various mobile, PC and network technologies, which include: Apple, Blackberry, Windows operating systems, and non-standards softwares approved through our Client Technology Reference Group (CTRG).
To ensure my clients gain the most from Information Service’s ICT services, I provide one-on-one training both in person and remotely for: use of mobile devices, use of applications and new operating systems. Not only do I manage client ICT requirements for the Brisbane South West region, I also work in the Brisbane CBD 2x days per week to assist with workload management and coordination.
I have extensive operational support in both Microsoft applications and operating systems. This is evident through my ability to respond rapidly to service incidents and requests, whilst recognising gaps and opportunities for improvement in current procedures.

jobs.description:
Here at Humanised Group we're passionate about partnering with our Client's in a way that allows us to become true representatives of their organisation. This means, developing a strong understanding not only of your business, but your culture, sub-cultures, Managers and their management style, growth plans and the things you have struggled with from a recruitment perspective, past and present. This approach allows us to be a true extension of your brand and a real advocate for your organisation and internal ethos in order to deliver a more tailored approach.

In addition, we see our Candidates as being equally as important as our Clients. Not only do we delve into our Candidate's technical capability, we like to know what motivates and demotivates them. We like to get a good understanding of not only their career plans, but what makes then tick as an individual and what makes them unique outside of their work life! By doing this, we can align their core values with not only their ideal role, but their ideal manager or mentor. By gathering this information, we're able to be proactive by taking our Candidate's details to market as opposed to a 'wait and see' approach - which is how we find most of our Candidate's their new and exciting opportunities! We're also here to give advice, coaching tips around CV's, interview techniques and market trends. 

Here at Humanised, we're not just about the transaction! Long term partnerships and a deeper understanding of our Clients and Candidates is paramount. 

Across Data Analytics and Business Intelligence (B.I) we specialise in temporary and permanent staffing solutions across all verticals relative to the Data Analytics space.

Collectively, we're meeting approximately 120 experienced Candidate's on a monthly basis and pride ourselves on having met and referenced these Candidate's before we represent them to our Clients.

In a world of generalist recruiters, I find myself to be a true specialist in Business Intelligence (BI) recruitment. My understanding and deep penetration of the market has allowed me to build unparalleled networks in the BI and analytics space, giving me access to some of the best talent in the sector today.  My number one goal is to become the ‘go-to’ Business Intelligence (BI) recruiter in the market.

general.description:
Who Am I? 

I am the founder of Digital Native Agency. A Technology and Digital focussed Talent Strategy business that helps organisations understand themselves so that they can find the technology talent who want to be part of that journey. 

I work with Business Owners, Executives and Team Leaders of Digital & tech-driven companies to help build sustainable and proactive talent acquisition & recruitment services. 

I am a senior recruitment leader and executive manager who has worked in technology and digital recruitment for ten years. I've worked with both global and sizeable local recruitment firms as well as a fast moving digital boutique recruitment businesses and have created and led teams who have delivered talent solutions to some of Australia's biggest companies. 

If your technology recruitment strategy is not delivering you the technology specialists you require and you want to unlock ways of doing things better or have any hiring to do urgently, please contact me via LinkedIn or phone on +61 408 966 944. 

If are interested in having a confidential discussion on your career or wish to chat about the job market, digital or recruitment industries? I am also available to take your call share a coffee/beer. 

Areas I focus I help organisations recruit for:

- Digital Strategy
- Agile Project & Product Delivery
- Software Development – SDLC Recruitment
- Digital and Technical Marketing
- DevOps and Cloud Infrastructure
- SecOps and Security

jobs.description:
Digital Talent Acquisition Consulting | Strategy | Recruitment

Digital & Technology talent is the some of the most actively sought after in Australia. The Digital revolution allows organisations of all sizes to harness innovation, technology and different business models to compete with, and even beat, well-established enterprises. Now more than ever talent matters.

For businesses to secure the most sought after talent, they need to shift from reactive tactical recruitment to a proactive strategic talent strategy.

Digital Native Talent is a boutique consulting firm that works with Digital & Technology centric businesses to ensure they have the talent acquisition strategy and processes in place that supports self-sufficiency, growth and drives competitive advantage.

Digital Native Talent leverages its network of industry experts and subject matter expertise to develop and enhance:

- Employment Brand
- Strategic Sourcing Strategy
- Candidate Experience
- Talent Acquisition Technology
- Benchmarking & Performance Analytics
- Business-Talent Alignment

Digital Native Recruitment complements our strategic offering by providing tactical recruitment services for filling critical digital and technology positions within your organisation.

Our recruitment offering specialises in:

- Digital Projects - Business Analysts | Scrum/Agile | Project Management | Product Management
- Software Development - Front End, Back End & Full Stack
- Testing - Automated, Manual & UAT
- Software & Product Architecture
- Digital Marketing

Our mission is to help organisations achieve business transformation and navigate the path towards innovation through IT-enabled product development that:

- Supports differentiated end-customer offerings.
- Improves both internal and external end-customer service experience helping achieve business objectives.
- Delivers new efficiencies to reduce the cost of operations.
- Supports customer and user engagement via qualitative and quantitative research and design thinking.

We deploy small teams to work on significant challenges in collaboration with our clients. We view our clients as partners who join the team to ensure we understand their business.

Putting users first and commitment to working together has demonstrated our ability to deliver successful projects consistently.

Just Digital People (JDP) are a national boutique digital recruitment firm.

general.headline: National Learning and Development Manager at Finite IT Recruitment Solutions
general.description:
Enjoying over 15 years in client management roles, My exposure to the Construction and  Development market started in 2010 and quickly became a genuine passion.  With national experience partnering with Blue Chip Client Side Consultancies and Tier One Contractors, I have successfully sourced and managed the very best talent for a variety of high profile and iconic projects.

Emerging from a management and strategy background and having qualifications in Leadership Management and Frontline Management, I combine my technical appreciation for the industry with an innate ability to identify the individuals that are not only technically qualified for our business requirements, but have the EQ, personal characteristics and skills to enable them to “fit” into a specific team dynamic. I am proactive, energetic and approachable in character with a genuine desire to ensure that all of Finite's teams are made of the best in the industry.

Outside of work, I can be found watching F1, either at home or when the opportunity and time arises, at the race track, wherever that is in the world.  Feel free to quiz me on Teams, Tracks, Tyre choices or even the F1 politics!

jobs.description:
In my role with The Finite Group I am fortunate enough to deliver training and development to our exceptional sales staff as well as identify new talent in Australia and NZ across all 4 of our brands (keeping my finger on the pulse and continuing to do what I love best, RECRUITMENT!) 

I manage a consistent recruitment process to be applied across all offices. This follows the path from job qualification, advertising, talent pool management, screening, profiling, behavioral interviewing, final stage review and referencing, and hiring cases. 

I deliver on office growth plans including succession and development training plans for future leaders as well as management of the recruitment of all internally vacant positions across operations not just sales, including strategic marketing campaigns. 

My role also includes visibility and control of any external agency relationships and budgets.
one thing I am passionate about is the construction and delivery of a bi-annual graduate program of 2-4 associate consultants starting in a resourcing role as I feel that this is where recruiters become the best they can be starting with candidate relationship management and solution delivery to they peers.

Along with this I ensure all employees have a consistent and positive on boarding experience including the facilitation of systems training and WHS (safety first!!)

The high energy and high reward element of my role is where I get to identify and drive relevant training material/sessions that will enhance the sales and soft skills of the team, delivered quarterly, I couple this with Lunch and Learn sessions monthly and weekly systems and sales tips across all of the brands. With this I can construct more tailored individual training plans and PIP sessions in collaboration with line managers.

At Huawei, my role was a combination of HR, People and culture and National Recruitment Manager (which was a promotion 3 months after joining as a Talent Acquisition Specialist). 

I was tasked with the acquisition of all senior and executive level employees and contractors. Huawei operated locally with a consulting staff of over 600 in our network delivery teams and 300 in operations 1200 staff across Australia contract and permanent. I recruited roles from CSO to Enterprise sales leaders and everything in between. I managed a team of 4 recruiters and was a part of the core HR leadership team. 

I had responsibility to attract local talent for Huawei and working in conjunction with the HQ rotating professionals, assessing their suitability to the teams here in Australia. 

I also managed a very successful graduate program of over 40 graduates rotating through our business across consumer, enterprise Delivery and service and operations such as marketing and finance. 

Huawei is a leading global ICT solutions provider. Through our dedication to customer-centric innovation and strong partnerships, we have established end-to-end capabilities and strengths across the carrier networks, enterprise, consumer, and cloud computing fields. Our products and solutions have been deployed in over 170 countries, serving more than one third of the world's population.

Huawei's vision is to enrich life through communication. By leveraging our experience and expertise in the ICT sector, we help bridge the digital divide by providing opportunities to enjoy broadband services, regardless of geographic location. Contributing to the sustainable development of society, the economy, and the environment, Huawei creates green solutions that enable customers to reduce power consumption, carbon emissions, and resource costs.

“Finite - Connecting Great People”

Finite is an ANZ based, leading independent ICT specialist recruitment company that currently supplies to many of Australia and New Zealand’s largest banks, telecommunications, commercial and State and Federal Government organisations. Finite provides permanent, executive and contract IT recruitment services and has an extensive database of quality candidates covering all technology skill disciplines. Established in 1998, Finite has grown rapidly to become Australia and New Zealand’s leading ICT recruiter of choice with offices in Sydney, Brisbane, Melbourne, Perth, Canberra, Adelaide and Auckland. Geraldine has strong expertise in effective stakeholder management, stakeholder engagement, change management strategies, relevant change plans, communication strategies, communication plans, business analysis, impact assessments, impact analysis, business readiness assessments, business readiness activities, training & coaching activities, human resources, benefits realisation activities, Go Live support, post implementation support, individual resistance strategies (Prosci ADKAR certified).  Geraldine has successfully lead & managed change through numerous large scale, complex transformation programs & ICT implementation projects, which have led to an increase in adoption, utilisation & proficiency of the new systems.  Some of the IT implementation projects include: Microsoft AX Finance, Office 365, Skype For Business, Cloud, SAP (HRM, Payroll, Finance), JDE, HRIS,  ESS, MSS, Oracle Peoplesoft (HR, Payroll, Finance), Windows 8.1 & 10, SOE upgrades, Microsoft Office, EDRMS, TRIM, SharePoint, RecordPoint, Chris22, Aurion, several digital projects).  Geraldine has significant experience working with Agile, PMBOK & PRINCE2.  Geraldine has a proven track record in leading change, communication & training teams through complex organisational change, M&A's and restructurings, which resulted in an increase in employee engagement/commitment & minimised resistance.  Have successfully lead change initiatives in global countries:  USA, Canada, UK, Brazil, Dubai, Africa, PNG, Fiji, Indonesia, New Caledonia, Australia & NZ.  Geraldine has a demonstrated ability to build strong trusting relationships with the senior leadership team & stakeholders at all levels.

general.description:
Creating strategies that are real,  visions that become reality, goals which are achieveable, David has a strong history of  producing excellent results for his clients, his people and ultimately for his company.  A  very likeable,  but  aggressive  and competitive person with  the need to perform.

A team player creating fantastic opportunities for life balance for his teams, with excitement and enthusiasm.
David has a strong history of producing excellent results for his clients, his people and ultimately for his company. 

David works hard to continuously develop markets globally, with innovative equipment which delivers and meets all the client’s needs and expectations, through the expected total cost of ownership model.  Ensuring the his team understands the company vision, strategies and goals to maximise their market growth, and at the same time ensuring his team enjoy and develop into world-class professional sales & marketing leaders, along with the correct mentoring and communication to keep them all at the highest point of their game. David motivates and drives his team to meet their expectations by ensuring that forecasting and availability of the right products is correct in order to deliver to their target market.  Everything David does must be at the highest level of integrity and trust to up-hold the core values and the quality product Austin continues produce. Structuring deals in today's ever changing environment is the key to David's success, Austin is an extremely exciting and innovative company with simple and transparent processes that allows David the necessary tools to ensure the sales and marketing team the opportunity to be the sole differential in the game today

jobs.jobTitle: HR Business Partner | Business Development Manager
jobs.description:
Optimised Maintenance is a Maintenance and Asset Management improvement consultancy. 

Optimised Maintenance Pty Ltd is a Maintenance and Asset Management improvement consultancy. Our focus is to reduce operating cost, identify and manage risk and liability, improve maintenance efficiency and improve the safe execution of maintenance. Through design and improvement of maintenance systems and procedural risk review, Optimised Maintenance works with business to improve the quality and effectiveness of maintenance by reducing spend, identifying and reducing risk, improving safe practice, and reviewing resource and support requirements.

We work with businesses to improve their understanding of risk and improvement opportunity for their assets. Our consultants have a variety of hands on industry experience which is used to create strategy review and documentation which reflects real world use. Using maintenance and engineering principles, maintenance, supply and asset management processes and applications are reviewed and improved. Optimised Maintenance focuses on material risk management, safety, governance, compliance, cost, sustainability, social effect, operational availability and environmental impact.

We are an Australian Company centrally located in Brisbane. Optimised Maintenance has the capacity to supply service anywhere.

This role has two main functions; maintaining a network of experienced software testing professionals for allocation to project work, and designing and implementation of strategies to create a sustainable and engaged workforce. Revolution IT Brisbane works under a philosophy of 'take care of the people, and they will take care of your customers'. My role is a facilitator of this philosophy by creating relevant, market leading training and development packages for consultants, promotion of consultants into areas of interest to help grow their skills, and ensuring technical and HR support is readily available to consultants so they can focus on what they do best!

jobs.jobTitle: IT Senior Consultant (Software Testing and QA)
jobs.description: This role was predominately focused on recruiting executive, technical, and business support staff in a wide range of industries on a permanent, temporary, and contract basis for my clients. Morgan Consulting's recruiters are first and foremost business people with an average of seven years working experience in the recruitment industry coupled with experience in their area of expertise - in my circumstance it was Software Testing and Quality Assurance.

•	Development of a recruitment and selection strategy for an Enterprise Testing Team with a focus on talent retention and versatility. 
•	Workforce Planning and resource management. 
•	Define, promote, and maintain positive customer engagement through strong relationship management.
•	Development and maintenance of project specific documentation to be utilised in the employee induction process to promote swift transition of candidates into the customer projects. 
•	Development of account management plans and other documentation to support a focused and thorough approach to account management. 
•	Market research.
•	Frequent communications with decision makers and other recipients of Access Testing’s services to ensure testing teams are on track for delivery of services.
•	Manage resources across multiple projects to deliver successful outcomes that are in line with organisational goals and strategies as required.
•	Maintenance of documentation of all server delivery activities to identify opportunities for engagement with service providers. 
•	Work with the procurement department for contractual matters.
•	Review and appraise activities and processes across the different projects and identify and promote strategy opportunities to achieve operational efficiencies. 
•	Ensure coordination of all operational/support activities of the service delivery stream to promote efficiency, maximise processing, throughput and output of support services.

Kate relocated to SA to open a new Access Testing branch in Adelaide to support ongoing growth and development in the region. She was responsible for business development and service delivery excellence in the provision of software testing services.

Responsibilities included: 
• Conducting market research and analysis including gather of statistical market information and interpreting the results into a tangible plan for Access Testing Adelaide moving forward. 
• Relationship building and corporate networking with key stakeholders and potential clients.
• Assisted development and execution of business and marketing plans, tracked and recorded in Salesforce (CRM). 
• Identify opportunities to provide managed testing services, resource based and assignment based resourcing. 
• Service delivery including recruitment and selection, talent management, induction, project management and communication. 
• Conducting regular research to ensure up-to-date knowledge of industry and market. 
• Development of sales forecasts for SA and management of budgets.

Reporting to the General Manager, Kate played a key role in the management and
      delivery of resourcing and generalist HR services to the Brisbane office. The businesses
      success is closely linked to its commitment to recruiting, training and recognising high
      
      quality people. Kate strived to employ a diverse range of people, skills and 

... See more

CCA is responsible for defining compliance and conformance assessment schemes and tools for health software systems based on national eHealth standards and specifications.

As a Project Coordinator for the Conformance, Compliance and Accreditation team Kate was responsible for directing and monitoring the requirments, framework and conditions of CCA projects which work towards the transition to a National eHealth system.

She was responsible for identifying constraints and setting a schedule to achieve the optimum results for the team, with the intended end result in mind. Kate managed technical and personnel resources to ensure project results conform to quality and time stipulations. A large portion of her role is identifying and maintaining relevant relationships with key stakeholders.

Kate was also responsible for configuration management of all CCA products, in addition to the coordination of conformance testing for various vendors. 

NEHTA is a Prince2 methodology environment.

The Department of Education was developed to engage Queenslanders in lifelong learning through education and training to enrich their lives. Queensland state school's are building a brighter future for hundreds of students under the $16.2 billion Building the Education Revolution (BER) program, with multi-million dollar project facilities to enhance and develop the young minds of our future generations. In support of this state initiative, the SCIP (School Connectivity Infrastructure Program) was developed. 

As a member of the SCIP program, Kate managed small projects (approx. $20K) end to end, which involved the installation of fibre cabelling between educational blocks and the upgrade of the schools centre of network (CoN). She was supporting the needs of approx 150 schools at any one time.

Responsibilities include scoping the work, engaging contractors, monitoring progress, ensuring work reflected the business case, communication with key stakeholders, managing project artefacts, monitoring budget and project closure. 

The department of Education works in a Prince2 environment to achieve optimum outcomes for its clients.

Employed within the Organisational Development team, and under the direct supervision of the Manager of HR Strategy, Kate was responsible for generalist HR tasks and Recruitment and Selection. Some of her responsibilities included:  
• Implementation of efficient and effective HR practices that are aligned to business objectives.
• Coordinate recruitment to maintain adequate manning levels for the business.
• HR administration including absenteeism, payroll support and HR reporting (FTE’s, demographic, EEO, availability etc).
• Development of contracts, terms and conditions of employment etc for new employees, transfers, secondments, promotions etc.
• Ensure compliance with legislation, policies and procedures, and support the discipline process.
• Provide support to the Learning and Development department.
• Develop effective relationships with all relevant external stakeholders.
• Assist with employee enquiries and ensure positive employee relations.
• Roll out of the employee on-boarding program for the Brisbane office.
• Management of personnel files in alignment with the Privacy Act.
• Process resignations and terminations.
• Maintain and update relevant HR forms.

QPS is a law enforcement agency, dedicated to ensuring the state of Queensland is a safe and secure place to live, visit and do business. Kate was employed within the Information Systems Branch (ISB) to provide support to vendors and stakeholders relating to the procurement process for Hardware, Software and Services. 

Kate was responsible for: 
• Management of the Human Resources component of the Vendor Management team.
• Coordination and management of the administration and HR projects for the Information Systems Branch.
• Database management.
• Client/Customer liaison with a range of internal and external stakeholders.  
• Implement and maintain systems and procedures to ensure the effective management work flows within the administrative support unit.
• Provision of professional administrative and secretarial support 
• Project a professional image at all times and display a high level of tact, diplomacy and confidentiality.
• Support the Managers of Technical Infrastructure, Business Services and Information Systems Branch in the absence of their Personal Assistants.

The Queensland Performing Arts Centre (QPAC) is an arts venue with a key focus on improving cultural, social and intellectual development of all Queenslanders through live performance, public participation, leaderships and commercial investment.

While employed at QPAC, Kate performed several roles facilitated by promotions, secondments and her general proactive approach and willingness to assist in any way she could. Kate was initially employed as a Corporate Customer Relations Officer where her primary responsibilities were to be the warm and welcoming face of QPAC. She had to gain a quick and vast knowledge of the operational aspects of the organisation and provide such information in a professional, assertive and sometimes discrete manner. Her success in this position lead to a secondment as the Corporate Development Officer where she was responsible for supporting corporate partnerships. This later became a promotion. A few short months into gaining this promotion she was asked to take on addition responsibilities as the Marketing Assistant in the substantives extended absence. In this role she was responsible for assisting the marketing team with various marketing tasks such as advertising, internet marketing, mail outs and engaging corporate partners.  In addition to these roles she was also an Usher for evening shows and assisted with the preparations for various shows.

The Sarina Russo Group is one of Australia's leading employment agencies with a comprehensive range of recruitment and training services offered to employers and jobseekers. 

Initially, Kate was employed as a Associate Employment Consultant assisting individuals on financial benefits through government support to discover employment opportunities. This involved registering candidates, providing a full service induction, assisting with training and development opportunities and placement. Most candidates fit into the category of highly disadvantaged or disabled so it was important to show sensitivity and support the ensure candidates reached their career goals.

Twelve months after her initial employment, Kate was promoted to Recruitment Administrator for the private recruitment arm of the Sarina Russo Group, Russo Recruitment. In this role she was responsible for responding the candidate and employer queries, screening and registering candidates, maintaining a Candidate Tracking System and general administrative tasks. On several occasions she was asked to step up into the Recruitment roles to provide temporary and permanent placement services to Russo Recruitment's clients. 

During her time with Sarina Russo she won several awards recognising her hard-work and dedication.

general.description:
Here at Humanised Group we're passionate about partnering with our Client's in a way that allows us to become true representatives of their organisation.  This means, developing a strong understanding not only of your business, but your culture, sub-cultures, Managers and their management style, growth plans and the things you have struggled with from a recruitment perspective, past and present.  This approach allows us to be a true extension of your brand and a real advocate for your organisation and internal ethos in order to deliver a more tailored approach.

In addition, we see our Candidates as being equally as important as our Clients. Not only do we delve into our Candidate's technical capability, we like to know what motivates and demotivates them.  We like to get a good understanding of not only their career plans, but what makes then tick as an individual and what makes them unique outside of their work life! By doing this, we can align their core values with not only their ideal role, but their ideal manager or mentor. By gathering this information, we're able to be proactive by taking our Candidate's details to market as opposed to a 'wait and see' approach - which is how we find most of our Candidate's their new and exciting opportunities! We're also here to give advice, coaching tips around CV's, interview techniques and market trends. 

Here at Humanised, we're not just about the transaction! Long term partnerships and a deeper understanding of our Clients and Candidates is paramount. 

Across our Accounting and Finance brand, we specialise in temporary or permanent staffing solutions across all verticals relative to the finance space. 

Collectively, we're meeting approximately 120 experienced Candidate's on a monthly basis and pride ourselves on having met and referenced these Candidate's before we represent them to our Clients.

jobs.description:
Here at Humanised Group I manage the Accounting and Finance Division, specialising across all verticals of finance recruitment from transactional to C-suite. 

Similar to my previous role, I am also responsible for staff training and development, for both my own team and other teams across the business, on selective topics. 

Now a well tenured Manager and recruitment specialist, I have a strong passion for partnering with my Clients and developing a deep understanding of their organisation, cultures and sub-cultures within their respective businesses.  I see the recruitment process as being a true partnership opportunity, that allows me to be an advocate for each Client I work with and their brand. 

In addition to this, I believe in a personal, customer service and outcomes driven approach. In working with us, you can expect honesty in our processes and a confidence that we have developed a strong enough understanding about you and your organisation to offer a tailored service and tailored temporary or permanent solutions. 

We're a referral based business with strong networks in the Brisbane market, so you won't often see us advertising on Seek. Therefore, you can have confidence that our inventory of Candidates will rarely be similar to those you would attract through a Seek advert. 

We pride ourselves on having interviewed and reference checked every Candidate before representing them for a role.  

All in all - we are passionate about what we do and like to shake up the recruitment market when it comes to going above and beyond for a Candidates or Clients!

Commencing my role as Division Manager in January of 2017, I maintained my Client focus outlined in the previous role whilst initially managing and supporting a team of two. 

In the first few months in this role, my team grew to four, which naturally saw my responsibility as a Manager double. 

As Manager, I was responsible for developing each team member through their initial training program, followed by consistent mentoring through their weekly and monthly KPI's to assist them in reaching their personal and professional goals.  I have a strong passion for individual and professional development and often individual and team wins would feel like my own. 

As a team, we reached some significant milestones during my time in this role, including significant year on year growth as a division, from a revenue and billing perspective. 

I was also responsible for training of new staff across other areas of the business on selective topics.

general.description:
Commercially astute and strategically focused Site Senior Executive, with extensive experience and proven record of success in all facets of mine site operations and major construction projects.  With demonstrated capability and expertise in operations management, change management, process improvement, health and safety management, I deliver improved financial performance and operational excellence in alignment with mine operations strategy.
Experienced in driving a continuous improvement culture and strategic process development, I have been directly responsible for improving profitability, safety and compliance performance.  A natural team leader and team manager, I provide leadership across mine operations and ensure that the business delivers on key performance indicators, service standards and operational requirements.

jobs.jobTitle: Safety, Health and Environment Manager / Relief SSE
jobs.description: In the position of Safety, Health and Environment Manager with Anglo American, I was responsible for reviewing the overall health, safety and environment processes for the Anglo American Grasstree site.  Managing a team of 6 direct reports and an overall team of 17 technical specialists, I provide key training and supervision to ensure that site safety and environmental performance improve, establishing a new electrical wiring plan and rollout across the site’s operations.  I coordinate with key site management staff to ensure we can coordinate the upgrade of electrical systems throughout the plant, develop electrical project plans, establish budget and timeline, and identify deficiencies in the Safety and Health Management System.  Furthermore, I implemented ‘Permit to Work’ and Contractor Management safety systems across the mine, resulting in the best safety record for an underground mine development in Australia.

jobs.jobTitle: Site Senior Executive & Electrical Engineering Manager
jobs.description: In my extensive and diverse position at BMA Caval Ridge, I was responsible for managing 3 mine site operations, 2800 staff, production management, financial management, and the preservation of cultural and environmentally sensitive areas.  Managing all site risks, safety performance, engineers, maintenance managers, production planners and the logistics team, I provided key guidance on overall operations to ensure that all teams worked together to improve overall performance.  Ensuring maintenance and shutdown activities were effectively managed to minimise disruption and maximise equipment lifespan, I also worked extensively with stakeholders and local representatives to achieve desirable outcomes for all parties involved with the mine operations whilst ensuring we met environmental and cultural heritage obligations.  I received company recognition for delivering significant decreases in operational costs, developed major agreements, and oversaw the development of the Caval Ridge Mine from first peg in the ground to the first coal.

jobs.jobTitle: Business Improvement and Compliance Manager | EEM Business Improvement
jobs.description: With Rio Tinto as a Business Improvement and Compliance Manager, I supported a high-performance culture that drove continual improvement and efficiency savings.  Promoting effective partnerships with stakeholders to achieve continuous improvement, I communicated priorities, plans, vision and objectives to the team to ensure we effectively delivered upon service standards and targets.  I developed strong performance management processes, monitored performance standards, and promoted the welfare of team members to ensure our principles were embedded across the team in all processes and communications.

As an Electrical Projects Superintendent and EEM I ensured that my assigned Capital Project works were delivered safely, on time, under budget and fit for purpose.  Improving the reliability of major electrical equipment through new maintenance strategies, I provided leadership and support for the electrical team, and effectively prioritised unplanned maintenance activities in consultation with production superintendents and management.  In addition, I provided engineering input on Hazardous Area equipment design, installation and maintenance, and on HV equipment performance, improving availability, reliability and integrity.

In the role of Electrical Engineering and Compliance Manager, I developed and oversaw control systems to prevent and deal with violations of legal guidelines.  Overseeing and preparing designs and work plans, I evaluated the efficiency of controls, oversaw maintenance, testing and repair of company equipment, and reviewed the work of colleagues to identify compliance issues, providing training if needed.  I planned and coordinated assigned projects and engineering work, and ensured all electrical engineering work was performed in accordance with all requirements and specifications.

general.headline: Head of Membership Services at Austmine
general.description:
Austmine is the leading industry body in Australia for the mining equipment, technology and services (METS) sector with over 480 member companies. We promote the advancement and competitive positioning of Australian technology and innovation in mining and resources. We act as a marketing and sales support to our members, leveraging our close working relationships with many of the mining houses here in Australia, plus our significant online presence and reach. We promote our members through online and social media activity, plus our events series. 

Our vision is to make Australia the true global hub for METS and continue to create opportunities for members globally through our international missions, which in 2018 will include PNG, Chile, Peru, Russia and the USA.

As the Membership and Communications Manager for Austmine, I am responsible for looking after our ever-growing membership base of 300+ Mining Equipment and Technology Services (METS) companies, ranging from small consultancies through to large major contractors and OEMs. I oversee new member acquisition, all external communications, website content, social media activity, member management and am involved in our event execution, most notably project managing the large scale conferences Austmine 2015 and IMARC 2015.

- Winning the first ever tendered event for the company with Austmine 2013, which we quadrupled in size and revenue from the previous event
- Growing the annual mining portfolio from 8 to 40 events 

Responsibilities Included:
•	Directly managing a cross functional team of marketing, sales and conference producers across the mining and energy sectors for the online community and both physical and virtual events
•	Generating, creating the content for, and marketing and securing attendance for two virtual events per month
•	Creating between 4 - 6 unique pieces of content per week for Mining IQ, writing newsletter copy, SEO driven website copy and proofreading all event websites and marketing copy.
•	Setting an annual budget and balancing a portfolio P&L to over deliver on targets
•	Identifying, generating and maintaining critical strategic partnerships within the mining industry, with both organisations and key individuals
•	Identifying business opportunities to run financially successful conferences within the mining and resources industries, and launching new events into these areas. 
•	Increasing annual conference revenue year on year to ensure portfolio and office growth.
•	Maintaining a high level of productivity within the team.
•	Training and development of new team members through group sessions and one on one coaching programmes.

I joined Jacob Fleming in August 2007, rapidly moving up from Senior Producer to Production Manager, to Deputy Production Director, which was my role for the last year in the company. I was responsible for: 
- Day to day management of the production division, which grew to a maximum of 14 under me, spanning Energy, HR and Finance
- Commercial topic generation and research for the energy division, driving topics such as Gas Storage and Infrastructure which made 65,000 Euros sponsorship and 71 paying delegates in its first year
- Liaising and communicating internally with other department heads in order to most effectively product manage and prioritise 
- Ensuring a team of 14 producers consistently met tight deadlines with quality products 
Recruitment and steady growth of the department
-  Driving training and topic determination for other global offices, predominantly the USA branch

I started my conference career at Marcus Evans straight after university, in the role of conference producer in the energy division. Key facets of the job role included:
- Researching with senior industry representatives on technical topics such as Pipeline Maintenance, or Contract Risk Management.
- Copy writing a draft agenda, plus marketing materials.
- Identifying, inviting and securing expert speakers for the conference line up, whilst balancing a limited budget.
- Identifying potential sponsor categories and companies and working with a Business Development manager in order to secure sponsorship revenue.
- Generating over £450,000 GP over my first 4 conferences, 3 of which were brand new events.
- Running conferences on site, crisis managing if speakers dropped out last minute as well as networking with clients for future business opportunities.

general.headline: Helping businesses find staff | Director - Coral Recruitment Solutions
general.description:
Coral Recruitment Solutions have a unique and flexible business model which allows us to operate not only in Brisbane, but also throughout Australia and across any industry sector.

The one size fits all approach of putting an advert on a job board and hoping for the best just doesn’t work! Likewise engaging a traditional recruitment agency can be a costly and frustrating experience in which you lose the control of the process and often don’t get the outcome you want.

At Coral Recruitment Solutions we understand the challenges you face and have designed our solutions with this in mind so that you can get the outcome you want without spending thousands of dollars or hours and hours of your time to achieve it.

•	We provide expertise and knowledge at an affordable price.
•	We can be your very own outsourced recruitment department!
•	We can take as much or as little of the recruitment work away from you and you still get to keep complete control of the outcome. Work on your business, not in your business!
•	We can help you with all aspects of the recruitment process and even provide advice on how to interview your candidate or develop a Position Description.
•	We work across all industries and locations in Australia!



To find out how we can help call us on 07 3353 9134 or visit our website www.coralrecruit.com.au

general.headline: Recruitment Partner at Rio Tinto
general.description:
Commenced mining career in 1994 working a variety of blue collar roles spanning exploration, production and construction within manganese, gold, oil and gas before attaining a mature age degree in Human Resources (language minor in Bahasa Indonesia.) In 2001, Matt then re-entered the mining industry professionally, with Henry Walker Eltin, then the world’s largest Mining and Civil Contractor, as an HR Generalist for all of HWE’s underground sites ahead of moving across into a pure in-house recruitment role for HWE.
 
Moving across into human resources consulting, for more than 7 years Matt professionally represented clients and candidates with sound expertise in senior Australasia expatriate mining recruitment most notably with Mining People International where Matt successfully headed up the SE Asia division for MPi. 

Matt was then enticed across to Jakarta with Thiess Contractors Indonesia (TCI) into an in-house HR Generalist and Senior Recruitment Specialist appointment. Thiess is the world’s largest Mining Services Company and up until mid 2013, employed over 9,500 people in Indonesia alone across 7 projects. For 4 years, Matt handled ALL expatriate recruitment spanning site based operations roles through to Jakarta Head Office executive appointments as well as the recruitment of senior business critical Indonesian national appointments spanning executive to senior managerial level. 

Following Thiess, Matt remained Jakarta based for an additional 4 years until June 2017 as Principal Consultant with Mining Alliance, an Australasian focused recruitment service provider who’s sole purpose is to seek out and close with the region’s highest quality clients and candidates in order to provide them with superior solutions and opportunities.

After living and working in Indonesia for 8 years, Matt relocated back to Australia in June 2017 and is now a Recruitment Partner with Rio Tinto, currently the second largest diversified mining house in the world.

jobs.description:

•	Establishing, developing and maintaining partnerships with key business stakeholders to ensure clarity of strategy and the translation of this into an effective recruitment strategy
•	Collaborating with business group leaders to understand business workforce plans and hiring requirements and ensuring sourcing strategies meet business needs

general.headline: Mining Talent Acquisition Specialist / Director at Rock People
general.description:
Alex is a recognised recruitment expert in professional and executive mining & energy appointments. He has a proven track record in executive search, professional technical recruitment and the delivery of international talent acquisition solutions to mining and energy across Australia, Asia, The Americas and EMEA. 

Alex's recruitment track record includes over 14 years specialising in professional technical & executive appointments including countless executive, operations management, project delivery, processing, maintenance, technical services and geology appointments across Australasia and internationally for expat assignments to over 40 different countries.

He commenced his career in Sydney with an international recruitment firm in 2005. After which, Alex successfully established and developed two professional & executive mining recruitment businesses, one in 2006 for CDI AndersElite (NYSE: CDI) and later in 2008 for Talent2 (ASX: TWO). 

In 2011, Alex launched Rock People, a specialist mining & energy talent solutions business providing innovative recruitment solutions including executive search, RPO and more. Rock People leverage extensive targeted search & recruitment experience, comprehensive networks and industry knowledge to deliver optimal hiring outcomes across the globe.

Alex's typical assignments include executive & board search, operations management, business development, sales & marketing, project development & project delivery, EPCM, supply chain, geology, engineering, metallurgy, maintenance, geotechnical engineering and drilling. 

Alex holds a BBA (Hons) and BA (Psych) from Macquarie University, Australia. He is a member of the AusIMM and GSA. He is also a Regional Ambassador for the Institute of Recruiters (IOR; www.ior.org.uk).

Specialties: Executive search, advertised & network recruitment, recruitment outsourcing solutions (RPO, MRS), market mapping & talent benchmarking for mining & energy.

jobs.description:
Continuing to build on his recruitment experience in mining executive, geology & engineering appointments, Alex established Rock People in early 2011. 

Rock People dig deep to unearth the best professional technical & leadership talent in the mining and energy sectors. We customise our recruitment solutions to meet client needs, incorporating industry leading recruitment methodologies combined with the latest in recruitment technologies to deliver fast and effective results to meet your needs anywhere in the world.

Operating through our Brisbane and London offices, Rock People's specialist mining & energy talent acquisition solutions include:
> Executive & Board Search

> Contract Staffing Solutions (including recruitment, visas & migration and payroll management on an 'in-country' / local basis for most countries across Australasia, Middle East, Europe and Africa)

My primary goal is helping Australia’s Minerals and Energy sector to get more value out of each day’s information.

Australia’s Minerals and Energy sector generates masses of data every day. If used correctly, it holds the key to realising higher levels of productivity and safety.

At CBO Telecommunications we’re moving beyond just providing reliable field mobility infrastructure, data and voice solutions, we are dedicated to helping Minerals and Energy with far greater challenges.

Our commitment is not only reliable / sustainable Telecommunication solutions, It’s our first, second and third response solutions that can make the real difference during emergency and rescue as well as to increasing daily productivity.

general.headline: Strategic Financial Adviser for  Resources & Mining Executives, Professionals & Mining Sector Allied Services Owners
general.description:
I help executives, professionals and business owners explore their financial options to implement a bespoke financial plan that enables financial and lifestyle choices that are not reliant upon ongoing employment or working in their businesses.

I’m ideally placed to engage in meaningful dialogues that include specialisations in managing complex employee share schemes, establishing income management structures for both wealth preservation and protection within a diversified and flexible platform, and providing assistance when negotiating remuneration packaging for executives. 

I deliver integrated solutions across investment portfolios, SMSFs, retirement planning, taxation efficiencies and a myriad of other solutions to demystify complex financial matters. 
 
I have a specialisation in executive share schemes working with executives to shore up a range of matters including financial consequences of the tax liabilities of employee share schemes possibly from other countries. I can help.

A former mining engineer, I understand that mining and resources professionals often work in pressurised and demanding environments which can prevent adequate analysis of complex financial matters in order to determine how best to harness the full benefit of income and earnings. 

For me, it’s all about creating freedom. That is, providing executives and professionals with the opportunity to make financial and lifestyle choices which are not reliant on ongoing employment or your business. I provide a regular and thorough review service, providing a discipline that provides direction for achieving the goals we help you to articulate.

Financial freedom - to find out how you can Make It Happen, I invite you to contact me on (07) 3007 2007 or bcribb@stratusfinancialgroup.com.au.

For further information see http://www.stratusfinancialgroup.com.au/Cribb.php

jobs.description:
At Resources Unearthed we are known for helping executives, professionals and business owners explore their financial options to implement a bespoke financial plan that aims to provide financial and lifestyle choices that are not reliant upon ongoing employment or working in their business.

We do this by managing complex executive share schemes; providing assistance with remuneration negotiations; and establishing income management structures for wealth creation and protection within a diversified and flexible services solution.

We offer an integrated financial solution that encompasses financial strategies for investments, SMSFs, retirement, estate planning and taxation in alignment with ‘big picture’ considerations that include property ownership and working overseas.

I have been leading our financial planning practice for 17 years.  We provide services to mining professionals from all over the world (from Yellowknife to Dubai) and Australia.  

I have experience working with;
* The Big 4 accounting firms worldwide to integrate our financial planning advice with your worldwide tax consequences
* Executive Share Plans and Options
* Listed ASX investments
* Self Managed Super Funds
* Estate Planning (Wills, Trusts and Estate Structuring)
* Personal Insurance Advice
* Long Term Financial Planning

Mining Professionals Only is a joint venture established by Stratus Financial Group and Lovetts Consulting Accountants, in consulting partnership with Hillhouse, Burrough, McKeown Solicitors. With each firm providing specialist services – Stratus offering financial planning, Lovetts managing accounting services and Hillhouse providing legal advice - the joint venture strives to provide a seamless, fully-integrated and coordinated financial and legal service for mining industry professional personnel and business owners involved in the mining industry.

general.headline: Partner, Executive Director & Chairman of the Board, COSOL
general.description:
Greg is an entrepreneurial Senior Executive with a proven track record in business leadership, development and delivery of large scale industrial investment projects, managing portfolios of sustaining capital projects, and capital productivity improvement.  He is a self-motivated innovator with well-developed business acumen and extensive international experience.  Greg is a collaborative leader with strong coaching and talent development skills, as demonstrated by many highly successful former employees.

Following 33 years of corporate employment with large “blue chip” mining and mineral processing companies, many of which were at Managing Director level, Greg has joined COSOL, a mid-size management consulting company with strong I.T. roots.

COSOL is a global, professional service provider, specialising in strategic advice and practical delivery to optimise clients’ business processes and technology (I.T.) systems.  COSOLs’ specialists have a valuable combination of asset intensive industry experience and technology systems expertise. This combination enables them to strategically plan, design, deliver and optimise operational and enterprise systems, improve business processes and efficiently solve the most complex issues; all specifically targeted to maximize value for their clients.  

When COSOL first formed in 2000, it focused on supporting the mining & minerals processing industries.  Since then, COSOL has earned tremendous respect also servicing other industries such as Energy Utilities, Defence, Oil, Gas & Petroleum, and Public Infrastructure, with more industries still to be added.

jobs.description:
I’m a Partner and Executive Director on the COSOL Board with responsibility for setting strategic direction, broadening COSOL’s product lines and opening new market segments.  Together with other members of the executive team, I assist with Business Development and sponsoring our Clients’ projects.

An area of particular personal interest is to further develop our support of Clients' capital project practices.  All companies who spend capital on projects need to find ways to squeeze more “bang for their capital buck”.  COSOL’s “Capital Productivity” business may be able to assist.

Global role accountable for delivery of all of the Iron Ore group's major projects as part
      
      of a $25B capital program.  The Iron Ore capital program was the largest in Rio Tinto.

After a significant business improvement and change management process, established the global central Project Management Office (PMO) for all Rio Tinto’s capital projects ($17B annual spend) to improve capital productivity through:
•	Providing ongoing governance, assurance and support to all capital projects
•	Developing and implementing standardised Project Management processes, systems and tools for global use across the organisation
•	Developing capability and skills to meet current and future project demands
•	Ensuring the right people were deployed on projects 
•	Reporting on and assisting the organisation with managing the global capital projects portfolio  

Prior to the establishment of the PMO, projects and programs were managed and governed by individual businesses.

Global role providing governance, support and advice to Project personnel within the
      various Product Groups to drive best practice in Project Development, Implementation
      and Value Delivery.  During this period, much of the thinking for the central projects
      
      organisation was developed and tested.

Post Rio Tinto’s acquisition of Alcan Inc., had global responsibility for Bauxite and
      Alumina major projects development, execution, systems and governance and
      
      dismantling of ALCENG.

Global accountability for all organisations that provided project management and engineering services to Alcan B&A, as well as groups that provided technical and project management governance.  The role included responsibility for all major projects (project pipeline in excess of $10B), delivery of major technology packages and the in-house engineering service provider, ALCENG.

jobs.description:
Automation Anywhere Enterprise is the culmination of more than a decade of innovation and experience in cognitive robotic process automation. At Automation Anywhere, we believe that people who have time to create, think, and discover build great companies. That's why we've dedicated the last decade to driving the adoption of robotic process automation technology in leading Financial Services, BPO, Healthcare, Technology, and Insurance companies—to name a few—across more than 90 countries. Our intelligent process robots transform the way businesses operate, delivering complex business and IT work across a range of processes including procure-to-pay, quote-to-cash, HR administration, claims processing, and thousands of other front and back office processes.

general.headline: CEO at Miswift Passenger Services
general.description:
The Mi Swift Passenger service was established back in 2002 with a view to becoming the best transportation option available in the Wellington Region. 
​
We have set out to achieve this by offering our riders the most reliable and safe rides anywhere in New Zealand. 
 
Things to note..
 
All our drivers are 100 % compliant with Land Transport Act for the operation of a passenger service.
They have completed all the required training and passed the necessary exams.
They all have Passenger Service Licenses
Certificates of Fitness for their vehicles.
They all have a P endorsement on their drivers license as required by law.
​
Rest assured that Mi Swift drivers are not only the safest, they will offer a friendly and reliable service,  and they will get you there in comfort .

Fast and friendly, we currently offer professional transportation services throughout the greater Wellington region. 
Our team is up for any job, from big to small. Wellington locals know that we stand behind our work, putting your satisfaction as our #1 priority. 
What really makes us stand out is our dedication, great prices and attention to detail. 
​
"Your driver made me feel like I was someone famous; he took such good care of me on my way to the airport. Whenever I’m in town, there’s absolutely no other company I could even think of using."

jobs.description:

general.headline: Vice President at DXC.Technology
general.description:
Stephen has an extensive background in the commercial and IT environment, including prior roles as CIO and Director Business Excellence for CSC Australia, CIO of BHP Billiton Base Metals based in South America, CIO WMC and BHP Billiton IT Integration Lead in which he led the technical integration of WMC into BHP Billiton as part of the $9.2B acquisition.  Stephen has also led strategic client engagements resulting in both major new business wins, including new clients for CSC.   Stephen has worked extensively in extending CSC business into Banking and has delivered year on year growth in Financial services since taking on the portfolio.  In addition to growing the domestic portfolio, Stephen has led growth in his portfolio in Asia, Japan and the USA.

Earlier in this career he held IT and commercial roles within Cable and Wireless, Boral and the Department of Defence. Stephen has significant global experience having worked in, and lived in, North and South America and having run complex projects and lead teams in Australia, Europe, South Africa, North America and South America. 

Stephen is a Fellow of the Financial Services Institute of Australasia (FFIN), a Senior Member of the Australian Computer Society (MACS) and a Member of the Australian Institute of Company Directors (MAICD). 
  
He has a personal passion for developing the role of ICT in society and business, increasing the profile of ICT in schools and universities and improving the professionalism of the IT.  Stephen also likes to be active in supporting the community and fund raising.

------------------------------
For business related contacts please call the switch of our Sydney Office +61 (2) 9034 3000. CSC is a global leader in technology enabled business solutions, with significant practices in consulting, systems integration and outsourcing services.

Alternately you can email me at kowal.public.email@gmail.com which I check weekly

jobs.jobTitle: Industry General Manager, Banking, Insurance and Capital Markets
jobs.description:
As Industry General Manager, Stephen is accountable for CSCs growth and P&L within all financial services sectors, including Banking, Insurance and Capital Markets.   In addition Stephen owns the global strategy for the CSC payments business. 

In addition in 2012 and 2013 Stephen had overall executive accountability and ownership for CSCs  growth and P&L within the QLD, NSW, VIC and South Australian public sectors.

Globally CSC is a leader in providing technology-enabled business solutions and services. With approximately 91,000 employees, CSC reported revenue of $17.3 billion for the 12 months ended Oct. 3, 2008. CSC makes change practical for leading financial services firms around the world. To complement its capabilities in consulting, systems integration, and business process and IT outsourcing, CSC brings deep financial services industry knowledge and experience, a comprehensive portfolio of financial services application software, and an extensive network of industry and technology partners. More than 10,000 CSC employees are dedicated to serving financial services clients, which include more than 1,200 major banks, insurers, and investment management and securities firms.

CSC serves nearly 5,500 financial services clients in 50 countries, including more than 1,200 of the world’s premier financial services organizations:

■ Nearly half of Fortune’s global 500 financial services companies
■ One-third of the world's top 50 banks
■ Two-thirds of the world’s top 50 insurers

general.headline: Regional Director at DXC Technology
general.description:
Greg has extensive experience across business having undertaken roles in delivering Defence and commercial technology projects, account management operations, business development, general management, process improvement and business change.   He has successfully managed product development projects from inception through to large scale production and support.

He has skills in general management including revenue and profit responsibility at the project and department level.  He has managed large groups of staff and has a solid track record of achieving results and managing people.  

Greg currently manages delivery of managed applications services across Australia and New Zealand with staff in Australia, New Zealand, India and Vietnam.  This role involves leadership of all operation and strategic aspects of the business.     

A passion for excellence has led Greg to various roles where he applied his experience to implement business change programs and create an environment for business success. As past member of the CSC Australia Strategic Initiative program, Greg was responsible for executing regional business improvement strategies for severval years. 

Greg assisted in the establishment the Project Management Institute (PMI), Sydney Australia Chapter and served on the Board of Directors for over 5 years, with two terms as President.  He is an Australian PMI Chapters Outstanding Leadership Award recipient.   

Greg commenced his career in the Royal Australian Air Force where he specialised in flight simulation.

jobs.description:
Set up from scratch and lead the enterprise RCA: Robotics (RDA/RPA) & Cognitive Automation (ML, Chatbot, Virtual Agents and AI) CoE including Target Operating Model, Framework, Delivery Model, Capabilities and Control Framework.

Manage and lead all commercial discussions with 3rd delivery parties and technology companies for   RCA. 

Develop and operationalise the Enterprise RCA strategy for Robotics Desktop Automation, Robotics Process Automation, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence and Virtual Agents (Chatbots and Avatars).

Manage and deploy the Enterprise RCA Program

Work and collaborate with fintech companies in the RCA space to assess their value for NAB. 

Select the future technologies for all RCA categories.

Key Responsibilities

Create and deliver the transformation program to improve customer experience, standardise services and processes and achieve cost savings. The program entails Process Architecture, Process Excellence (PEX), Robotics, Work Management (IWM) and Digitalisation.

Develop the 3-year business case for the global transformation program incl. extensive Operations Diagnostics across GO’s nearshore, offshore and onshore entities as well as metrics development

Engage with GO Senior Management Members to educate, influence and align on establishing Operations Excellence programs across their respective areas

Thought leader for the `UBS Robotics Strategy and Approach. This includes the Operating Model, Virtual Operations Centre Set Up, Robotics Control Framework and Change Management within existing GO facilities

general.headline: Vice President, Robotic Process Automation at CoSourcing Partners
general.description:
In 2016, Rita joined CoSourcing Partners™, and plays a strategic and tactical role building the Company’s Robotic Process Automation solutions practice.  Rita will drive strategic Robotic Process Automation expertise leveraging her RPA process subject matter expertise in helping our clients receive clear understanding and recognizes the economic value of RPA.  As Vice President, Robotic Process Automation Rita will provide process assessments, proof-of-values, implementation plans, deployment, training, support and post implementation robots enhancement.
 
CoSourcing Partners™ has received many awards including:
 
·         2016 TechServe Alliance Excellence Award
·         2016 Inc. 5000 fastest-growing private company in America Award          
·         2016 National Association Business Review Elite Award for Recruiting
·         2016 Chicago’s 101 Best & Brightest Companies to Work for Award
·         2015 TechServe Alliance Excellence Award
·         2015 Inc. 5000 fastest-growing private company in America Award
·         2014 TechServe Alliance Excellence Award
 
Prior to joining CoSourcing Partners™ Rita was a Robotics and Automation Transformation Lead where Rita utilized her executive-level shared services expertise, consulting with Fortune 100 companies interested in optimizing back-office operations via robotics and automation.
